column4: hey guys im having a weird issue. I just had a power outtage that lasted longer than my UPS could handle. Anyhow the system came back up nicely but i have 2 raid arrays that arent mounted but when i try to mount the manually by running sudo mount -a it tells me that its either mounted or the mount point is busy. when i type mount it doesnt show up that its mounted and when i umount it it says its not mounted any advice?
hardware
and ive logged into the controller and everythin is OK
it has bbu shes good to go
Can you mount the array from a LiveCD?
Try mounting to /mnt just as a test.
Can you pastebin the contents of /proc/mounts ?
one second
how do i get that info
cat /proc/mounts
http://pastebin.com/0a0asJ5f
Ahh, the problem may have something to do with the fact that you have an msdos and gpt label, when normally with gpt your msdos label should only contain a single protective partition.
What is the output of "readlink /dev/disk/by-uuid/d4aec111-f1b8-4cc2-a0c3-cd978d762dd5"?
Never mind what I said about GPT, I was just confused since /dev/sda uses an msdos label while /dev/sdb and /dev/sdc use gpt (and have a proper protective partition)
ok did you see the reply about the read link output
Yes.
http://pastebin.com/mjr1iLs3
Ok, fsck is running for some reason. Do *not* kill it.
because its running thats why i cant mount it?
Yes.
Yes.
And with the size of your arrays it's going to take a while.
